org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.provider

Interface LocalResourceProvider<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the resource

    public interface LocalResourceProvider<T>
    The interface that provides possibility to plug-in right before a remote resource retrieval. The implementation of concrete type is optional and will be used once binded in configuration.

    To bind a concrete implementation use this in your guice module: 

    bind( new TypeLiteral<LocalResourceProvider<MyResource>>(){} )
      .to( MyResourceProvider.class );
    Author:
    Aurel Medvegy

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get(Identifier identifier, Map<String,Object> parameters, Locale locale)
      Retrieve a local resource to avoid a remote call.
      void persist(T instance, Identifier identifier, Map<String,Object> parameters, Locale locale, Long lastFor)
      Optionally, persist the resource instance as a result of the remote call.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get(@Nonnull
    Identifier identifier,
    @Nullable
    Map<String,Object> parameters,
    @Nullable
    Locale locale)
        Retrieve a local resource to avoid a remote call. Note: if this method returns null the persist(Object, Identifier, Map, Locale, Long) will be called once a remote call returns a non null value. Processed in the same thread.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the unique (root) identifier of the resource
        parameters - the optional resource parameters
        locale - the language the client has configured to prefer in results if applicable
        Returns:
        the locally cached or stored resource if exist, otherwise returns null

      • persist

        void persist(@Nonnull
           T instance,
           @Nonnull
           Identifier identifier,
           @Nullable
           Map<String,Object> parameters,
           @Nullable
           Locale locale,
           @Nullable
           Long lastFor)
        Optionally, persist the resource instance as a result of the remote call. This method will be called in case if get(Identifier, Map, Locale) returns null and for a non null result of the remote call. Processed in the same thread.

        Note: prefer asynchronous implementation.

        Parameters:
        instance - the resource instance to be either persisted or cached
        identifier - the unique (root) identifier of the resource
        parameters - the optional resource parameters
        locale - the language the client has configured to prefer in results if applicable
        lastFor - the time in milliseconds how long to keep the resource cached, null for undefined
